intro: Drimys granadensis var. campestris, commonly known as the Campestris Drimys, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Winteraceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in cloud forests or along stream banks. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, while its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in its native habitat.
